channel.title: [TUT] How to Refresh your teamviewer trial
channel.description:
[u][size=10pt]Here’s a solution to fix this problem :[/size][/u]
[u][b]1>[/b][/u] First uninstall the copy of Teamviewer from your system. This can be done with free uninstallers or by using Window’s default ‘Add or remove‘ program which can be found at: ‘Start’ –> ‘Settings’ –> ‘Control Panel’
[u][b]2>[/b][/u] Click on Start –> Run –> type %appdata% –> delete TeamViewer folder and also delete “C:\\Program Files\\Teamviewer”
[u][b]3>[/b][/u] Delete registry folder: hkcu/software/teamviewer and hklm/software/teamviewer
[u][b]4>[/b][/u] Clean your systems registry – you can use a free registry cleaner for this purpose- http://www.piriform.com/ccleaner/download/professional
[u][b]5>[/b][/u] Once you have completely wiped out Teamviewer out of your system – install a fresh copy of Teamviewer.

item.title: [TUT] How to Refresh your teamviewer trial
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“SCFTW, post:4, topic:464598”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=568662.msg4127669#msg4127669 date=1350672668]

  1. There isn’t a team viewer trial, unless you’re an idiot and download the commercial version.
  2. This isn’t a server tutorial.

[/quote][/quote]

Why the hell did you feel the need to bump this??? just let it die

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT] How to Refresh your teamviewer trial

item.title: [TUT] How to Refresh your teamviewer trial
item.dc:creator: @methodd methodd
item.description:
@methodd wrote:

[size=10pt]Here’s a solution to fix this problem :[/size]

1> First uninstall the copy of Teamviewer from your system. This can be done with free uninstallers or by using Window’s default ‘Add or remove‘ program which can be found at: ‘Start’ –> ‘Settings’ –> ‘Control Panel’

2> Click on Start –> Run –> type %appdata% –> delete TeamViewer folder and also delete “C:\Program Files\Teamviewer”

3> Delete registry folder: hkcu/software/teamviewer and hklm/software/teamviewer

4> Clean your systems registry – you can use a free registry cleaner for this purpose- http://www.piriform.com/ccleaner/download/professional

5> Once you have completely wiped out Teamviewer out of your system – install a fresh copy of Teamviewer.

Read full topic
